data.title: Who is Joe Lewis? British billionaire charged in U.S for insider trading; here's how he made his fortune
data.meta_description: Joe Lewis, the billionaire owner of Tottenham Hotspur, initially built his fortune with themed restaurants and later excelled in currency trading. Through his investment firm, Tavistock Group, he diversified into real estate, sports, luxury hotels, and biotech. His art collection and high-profile investments further contribute to his prominence in the business world.
data.text:
Synopsis

Joe Lewis, the billionaire owner of Tottenham Hotspur, initially built his fortune with themed restaurants and later excelled in currency trading. Through his investment firm, Tavistock Group, he diversified into real estate, sports, luxury hotels, and biotech. His art collection and high-profile investments further contribute to his prominence in the business world.

British billionaire Joe Lewis, renowned as the owner of the prestigious Tottenham Hotspur soccer club in London, now faces serious legal troubles in the United States. Federal prosecutors in New York have levelled charges of insider trading against the 86-year-old mogul. The indictment alleges that Lewis disclosed confidential information from companies in which he held substantial investments to his inner circle, including personal pilots, assistants, and romantic partners. As the founder of investment firm Tavistock Group, Lewis is accused of committing 16 counts of securities fraud and three counts of conspiracy, spanning a period from 2013 to 2021.

#Budget' 2024 with ET

Union Budget 2024 Live Updates

With a staggering net worth of $6.1 billion, according to Forbes magazine, Lewis' reputation as a high-profile billionaire magnate has been tarnished by these grave allegations. As the legal proceedings unfold, the outcome remains uncertain, and Lewis's financial empire and soccer club ownership could potentially be impacted.

FILE PHOTO: - Tottenham Hotspur v Southampton - Barclays Premier League - White Hart Lane - 8/5/16 Tottenham Hotspur owner Joe Lewis (L) and chairman Daniel Levy in the stands Reuters / Dylan Martinez Livepic

Who is Joe Lewis?

Joe Lewis, the British billionaire and owner of Tottenham Hotspur soccer club, has a fascinating journey to his billionaire status. He initially built a small fortune through a themed restaurant chain before venturing into currency trading in the late 70s. His remarkable success in the 90s came from astute bets against the British pound and Mexican peso, amassing hundreds of millions.

Utilizing his investment vehicle, Tavistock Group, Lewis diversified his portfolio into various sectors, including real estate, sports, luxury hotels, and biotech. His holding company ENIC acquired a controlling interest in Tottenham in 2001, elevating him to national prominence as a key figure in North London's Premier League soccer scene.

In the US, Tavistock's investments span a wide range, encompassing the Boston Waterfront redevelopment, the Wellington Equestrian and Golf Club near Palm Beach, Florida, and the St. Regis hotel in Atlanta, Georgia.

FILE PHOTO: - Tottenham Hotspur v Southampton - Barclays Premier League - White Hart Lane, London, Britain - May 8, 2016 Tottenham Hotspur owner Joe Lewis (L) and chairman Daniel Levy Action Images via Reuters/John Sibley/File Photo

Lewis's foray into the financial sector includes taking a significant 10% stake in Bear Stearns in 2007, right before the Wall Street bank narrowly escaped collapse and was acquired by JPMorgan Chase at a discounted price. This venture resulted in considerable losses, estimated at over $1 billion.

Apart from his business ventures, Lewis is well-known for owning the exclusive Albany Bahamas Club, an enclave catering to the ultra-rich and boasting celebrity residents like singer Justin Timberlake, golfers Tiger Woods and Ernie Els, and former FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried before his arrest last year.

Lewis's passion for art is evident in his significant art collection, including a David Hockney piece that he sold for a staggering $90.3 million in 2018. This transaction set a record at the time for the most expensive piece by a living artist sold at auction.

Through his diverse investments and ventures, Joe Lewis has risen to become one of the most prominent and influential figures in the business and sports world. His journey from themed restaurants to currency trading and beyond reflects his sharp acumen and relentless pursuit of success in various industries. With his status as a billionaire and ownership of Tottenham Hotspur, Lewis's impact on both the financial and sporting landscapes continues to captivate attention worldwide.
